answers.answer: go see the doctor immediately, this could be symptoms of swelling allergy or even cancer so i suggest go see your GP

Hi steph .If i was you i would be asking for a biopsy of this mass they have found in the right side of your neck,Especially to rule out the cause, we dont get masses for no true cause.Be adamant about this and dont be fobbed off for no-one.Explain about the family link of Lymphoma, and ask for your mass to be BIOPSIED.Good luck, and i hope you get some answers soon, for this problem.Let them know because of the family history, and you not knowing what it is .That this is causing you great stress.All masses should be Biopsied and tested.Good luckKeep me postedNicola

question: I am a 24 year old female who is normally a very heatlhy person. About a week before my period I start getting cold and flu like symptoms. I ignored them thinking that I just have severe PMS symptoms.About six months ago I noticed a lump on the right side of my neck. The doctors have checked me for diabetes, mono, thyroid, lupus, and many other things. I have also had a CT on the neck and an upper GI. The upper GI came back clear and the ct showed that i had a mass in my neck but they didnt do anything about it. Lymphoma is strong in my family and I am a little nervous. What should I do?
title: lump in neck
